Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the IAD reasonably concluded Jin was not employed full-time by a Canadian business and lacked sufficient humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Application_Facts: Jin was absent from Canada for 1,118 days; provided evidence of employment with J Brother and Dragon Mart but lacked proof of remuneration and consistent documentation
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: IAD dismissed appeal; Federal Court upheld decision
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to overturn removal order
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Federal Court dismissed application for judicial review
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Prolonged absence from Canada, failure to demonstrate full-time employment abroad
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Full-time employment abroad by a Canadian business, humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to IAD's decision
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility of Jin’s testimony, strength of employment evidence, ties to Canada
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Appeal before IAD followed by judicial review in Federal Court
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: IAD found Jin's testimony inconsistent and lacking credibility
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Employment contracts, corporate documents, travel records, testimonies
Crimes.Application_Basis: Failure to meet 730-day physical presence requirement or exemption under full-time employment abroad
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Corporate affiliation, job duties, payment records, duration and nature of work
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Cancellation of removal order based on residency exemption or H&C considerations
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Permanent residents must be physically present in Canada for 730 days unless exempt
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of payroll records, tax documents, or verifiable remuneration proof
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration Appeal Division (IAD), reviewed by Federal Court
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of deportation due to failed residency compliance
Crimes.Cause_Description: Jin did not meet residency requirements and appealed removal order based on employment and H&C grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: IAD assessed documentary and testimonial evidence with skepticism due to inconsistencies
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Inconsistent statements, lack of financial proof, insufficient employer verification
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failed – only 730 required, Jin was absent 1,118 days
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Not formally alleged, but credibility concerns affected assessment
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Jurisdiction of IAD and Federal Court under IRPA framework
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Employment evidence deemed unconvincing due to gaps and lack of corroboration
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Insufficient proof of full-time employment abroad and weak humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Country_of_Origin: China (implied by business operations in Guangzhou)
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of independent verification of employment and income
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness of administrative decision under IRPA

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to meet residency obligation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Residency obligation and humanitarian and compassionate grounds appeal
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Full-time employment abroad by a Canadian business, humanitarian and compassionate considerations
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Overturn removal order through appeal and judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Proof of full-time employment abroad by a Canadian business, strong H&C ties to Canada
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: IAD and Federal Court dismissed appeal and judicial review
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Full-time employment abroad by a Canadian business
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, witness testimony, corporate records
Crimes.Individual_Status_or_Claim: Permanent resident seeking exemption from residency requirement
Crimes.Temporal_Context: Five-year residency period ending with over 1,118 days of absence
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Work conducted in China (Guangzhou) for entities linked to Canada
Crimes.Personal_Data_Implicated: Travel history, employment history, family ties in Canada
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness of IAD's factual findings and legal interpretation
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Denial of residency exemption and H&C relief
Crimes.Protection_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds for remaining in Canada
Crimes.Credibility: Found lacking by IAD due to inconsistent testimony and insufficient evidence
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Administrative removal, not persecution or harm
Crimes.Enforcement_Action: Issuance and enforcement of removal order
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Lawful permanent resident at time of violation
Crimes.Perpetrator_Entity: None – regulatory enforcement by state authority
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Failure to meet statutory residency obligation under IRPA
